Articles.Content:
Sooo.. I've been enjoyng KSP in 0.19 for the last few days with somewhat of a low framerate due to my old ass computer (About 15-20 fps), but having an overall awesome experience. Until yesterday when steam decided to automatically download the new update and screwed me up, I know the update should have optimized the code but it certainly didn't work for me since it lags like crazy, I can't use rovers anymore because whenever I turn KSP basically dies ....

(And chairs,flags,etc.. are not really worth it in my opinion.)

So, basically...

I'd like to bring back the good old 0.19! Any help?
That is not going to be possible, I'm afraid, unless you made a backup of 0.19 somewhere you can't get a previous version back.
This is the reason I didn't switch my store account to steam.
Just try to be patient. The devs are working on patches to these problems. If they aren't, and if this is legal, I can pull .19 out of the recycle bin on my computer and send it to you.
completely uninstall the game, including finding your install folder and deleting it. completely. then re-install.

The devs are working on patches to these problems.

Where did you hear this?

This is the reason I didn't switch my store account to steam.

Pretty much this, steam work great for most games but not for KSP who is during development. Not only mod incompatibility.

Imagine you are about to do an Jool aerobrake but has to leave for work so you exit the game, coming back reentry heat is added. You are inside Laythe orbit and has less than 1000m/s dv left
Sorry, I assume they are working on a patch.

Pretty much this, steam work great for most games but not for KSP who is during development. Not only mod incompatibility.

Imagine you are about to do an Jool aerobrake but has to leave for work so you exit the game, coming back reentry heat is added. You are inside Laythe orbit and has less than 1000m/s dv left

you have an option on the steam client to not automatically download and update games \ specific game, do this for KSP if you find this feature to be problematic...

you have an option on the steam client to not automatically download and update games \ specific game, do this for KSP if you find this feature to be problematic...

You know I would normally say the same thing. However, I have my steam set to not automatically update KSP and it did anyway. So that idea is a bust.

The game is in an alpha state though, so I never had any concept of keeping anything I was working on. YMMV.
